ðŸŒ‰ BRIDGE SOL TO POLYGON

ðŸ“ Your Wallets:
ðŸ”¶ Solana: CwQ6dqwT2TFuftYpf2isA7HMRSzZbVQLF95EmU8Noyz
ðŸ”· Polygon: 0xE235db7fcbc64161028eFbc0E131852188d8f11D

ðŸ’° Current SOL Balance: 0.0000 SOL

ðŸ’¡ How it works:
1. Send SOL to your Solana address above
2. Use this command to bridge
3. Receive USDC.e + POL on Polygon automatically

âš¡ Features:
â€¢ Auto-convert SOL â†’ USDC â†’ USDC.e
â€¢ Auto gas refuel (~3 POL)
â€¢ All-in-one solution
â€¢ Takes ~3-5 minutes
        

âš ï¸ Minimum required: 0.1 SOL

Please send SOL to your address above first.
column6: Checks Solana balance + Allows Solana Bridge if balance >= 0.1 when user clicks button
column7: If Balance ok then "Bridge Auto", otherwise "Refresh balance"
column8:
Bridge Started ! 

add bridging infodynamically 

show final balance and debridge fees
column9: Bridge from Solana Adress to Polygon address (first swap from sol to usdc then use debridge to bridge usdc to POL then swap 95% of POL to usdc.e)

Buttons side by side :
By Volume
By Creation Date
Trending
column5: NA

each button reorder the markets based on the selected button

By volume is the default (if possible, show which order is in place)
if  trending is selected, then markets repop with the correct order

column3:
MARKETS

Display top 10 markets by volume
column4:
1 button per Categories

Geopolitics, Crypto, Sports, Others
column5: NA
column6: Displays markets of the selected category

column3:
MARKETS

Display top 10 markets by volume
column4: 1 buttons per market displayed (10 markets so 10 buttons)
column5:
Context : First scenario -> selected "market" is an event, in other words, a group of markets. Example : Who will win the Superbowl 2026 ? There a several teams that could win it (several sub markets then), each one get its own YES/NO outcome.

Copy: Titre of the event selected with a few statistics (volume, creaton date)
With all sub markets displayed, with statistics like volume and yes/no price (10max per page)
column6: Displays selected event with submarkets
column7:
1 button per sub market
1 button for the pages (next/previous)
column8: Displays market and information abt it
column9: Then its the same flow as below, the one for a single market with 4 buttons, instant buys YES or NO or Limit BUY YES/NO and following path

column3:
MARKETS

Display top 10 markets by volume
column4: 1 buttons per market displayed (10 markets so 10 buttons)
column5:
Context : Second scenario, "market" is a simple marke. Example : "Will Trump and Poutine meet in 2025?". The outcome is yes/no.

Copy: Title of the event selected and a few statistics (volume, yes no price)
column6: Displays market and information abt it
column7: Instant Buy Yes at Current price
column8:
repeat the market title  and main relevant info

and asks user how much he wants to spend
column9: Get the amount the users want to spend on this market and outcome
column11: Bot asks the user the amount he wants to spend (for him to enter it via typing) and re-show info of the selection (market title, outcome selected)
column12: confirm the amount the user wants to spend
column13: and then confirm the whole transaction
